p:
Thus, although SP is constrained in setting the target-level abatements at the actual abatement levels if there would be no permit market, so
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ {T}_i^{SP}={A}_i^S $$\end{document}
T i SP
=
A i S
, the global permit market incentivizes individual countries to abate up to the point where their marginal cost are equal to the permit price. Both inefficiencies of the non-cooperative Nash outcome are then removed. Because of the permit market, the production inefficiency is removed and the IPCC or SP can impose the required global abatement level A âˆ˜.
